pageContext.claim: “To show you how dishonest the LameStream Media is, I used the word Liddle’, not Liddle, in discribing Corrupt Congressman Liddle’ Adam Schiff. Low ratings @CNN purposely took the hyphen out and said I spelled the word little wrong. A small but never ending situation with CNN!”
pageContext.analysis: Trump referred to a hyphen when he apparently meant apostrophe. But an apostrophe is used when characters have been taken out of a word — as in “I'm goin’ to the store,” or “Li’l Abner,” or “Lyin’ Ted Cruz.” Liddle’ is missing no letters; it’s just a strange spelling of “little” with a superfluous mark at the end.
